data: Advise patient to return to PD clinic within 72 hours
Notify Peritoneal Dialysis clinic of patient treatment for peritonitis
Contact PD Nursing staff to initiate Peritonitis Empiric Treatment
For patients presenting with signs and symptoms of peritonitis (abdominal pain, cloudy dialysate or a dialysate white cell count of more than 100 mega/L with greater than 50% PMNs)
If patient has PD fluid in abdomen, ensure at least 2 hours dwell prior to taking samples
If patient does not have PD fluid in abdomen, instill dialysate and dwell for 2 hours prior to taking sample
1000 unit/mL, intraperitoneal, as directed, drug form: inj
Review with Nephrology prior to ordering antimicrobial medication

Indications for intraperitoneal antibiotic treatment:
- Cloudy dialysate by visual inspection
- PD fluid WBC count 100 mega/L or more, of which 50% or more are neutrophils
- Positive gram stain or C&S
If: If clinical indications are present Then: nurse to proceed with antibiotic administration
vancomycin and tobramycin combination should be the default empiric treatment if there is no current or past microbiology for guidance

1) No Allergy to cephalosporins: 
ceFAZolin 2 g AND cefTAZidime 2 g intraperitoneal with one exchange 
OR
if MRSA/MRSE history:
vancomycin (30 mg/kg to maximum of 3 g; round dose to nearest 250 mg) AND cefTAZidime 2 g intraperitoneal with one exchange

2) Allergy to cephalosporins:
vancomycin (30 mg/kg to a maximum of 3 g; round dose to the nearest 250 mg) intraperitoneal AND tobramycin (1.5 mg/kg to a maximum of 160 mg intraperitoneal with one exchange
Order (vancomycin OR ceFAZolin) and (tobramycin OR cefTAZidime)
1500 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg, intraperitoneal, qdaily, special instructions: Add to 2 L bag of dialysate solution. Dwell for 6 hours before next exchange, drug form: inj, dispense qty: 2 vials
2000 mg 1.5 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg, intraperitoneal, qdaily, special instructions: Add to 2 L bag of dialysate solution. Dwell for 6 hours before next exchange, drug form: inj, dispense qty: 2 vials
30 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
3000 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
1500 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg, intraperitoneal, qdaily, special instructions: Add to 2 L bag of dialysate solution. Dwell for 6 hours before next exchange, drug form: inj, dispense qty: 2 vials
1.7 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
170 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
1.7 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
175 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg 1.5 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
2000 mg, intraperitoneal, qdaily, special instructions: Add to 2 L bag of dialysate solution. Dwell for 6 hours before next exchange, drug form: inj, dispense qty: 2 vials
100 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 14 days, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 14 tab
Order dialysate cell count fluid and body fluid culture
If: Suspect site infection, Then: nurse to order wound culture
Dialysis fluid should be sent after a dwell time of at least 2 hours. Instill intraperitoneal antibiotics after dialysate fluid specimen collected
RN to place lab order for blood cultures x 2 if temperature greater than 38 DegC on admission
If/when: temperature greater than 38 DegC, then order and draw Blood Cultures x 2
dialysate fluid, STAT,  Collection: T;N, once
Placeholder: Cell count with differential, body fluid
dialysate fluid, STAT,  Collection: T;N, once
drainage, catheter sitem STAT,  Unit Collect, once
